data.title: Comparison of Tesla Models: Model S, Model 3, Model X, Model Y
data.content: Comparison of Tesla Models: Model S, Model 3, Model X, Model Y Skip to content Free express shipping ONLINE STORE | ONLINE STORE Menu Menu Charge e-Chargers Trydan Home Trydan Pro Business Pole Pro Business and public spaces Denka NEW Fast charging EV Portable Portable charger Explore more Buy online Software Efficient energy management V2C Cloud Free app V2C Payments Payment system Install Find your installer We help you find your nearest installer Become an installer Enjoy the benefits for professionals Support Support Area Resolve the most common questions Trydan Trydan Pro Pole Pro Denka EV Portable V2C Cloud V2C Training Train for free Connect? Online store Comparison Between Tesla Models: Model S, Model 3, Model X, and Model Y July 5, 2024 June 10, 2024 by V2C Over the past decade, Tesla Motors has spearheaded the electric vehicle revolution , challenging the norms of the automotive industry with its innovative approach and commitment to sustainability. Tesla has been a catalyst for the shift towards cleaner and more efficient mobility. In this context, it is important to compare the various Tesla models: the Model S, Model 3, Model X, and Model Y. These vehicles represent different market segments and offer a variety of features and performance levels , prompting an examination of how they differ from each other and how they have contributed to the advancement of electric car history . 1 How do the prices of Tesla models compare? 1.1 Tesla Model S: Starting at 92,990€ 1.2 Tesla Model 3: Starting at 39,990€, the cheapest Tesla 1.3 Tesla Model X: The most expensive Tesla starting at 99,990€ 1.4 Tesla Model Y: One of the cheaper options starting at 44,990€ 2 How do Tesla models compare in terms of range? 2.1 Tesla Model S: The best range on the market 2.2 Tesla Model 3: The compact model with substantial range 2.3 Tesla Model X: Designed for long journeys 2.4 Tesla Model Y: The model with the least range 3 How do the sizes of Tesla models compare? 3.1 Tesla Model S: The most luxurious interior on the market 3.2 Tesla Model 3: The most compact electric car 3.3 Tesla Model X: The largest sports model from Tesla 3.4 Tesla Model Y: A trunk suited to its size 4 How safe are Tesla models? 4.1 Tesla Model S: The most adaptable interior 4.2 Tesla Model 3: A small and safe model 4.3 Tesla Model X: The vehicle with the best access 4.4 Tesla Model Y: Equipped with over-the-air updates 5 What are the battery capacities of Tesla models? 5.1 Tesla Model S: A more powerful battery than other models 5.2 Tesla Model 3: The most optimal battery 5.3 Tesla Model X: The SUV with less battery life 5.4 Tesla Model Y: Various customization options 6 What type of charger does a Tesla use? 7 Compare the different Tesla models and find yours How do the prices of Tesla models compare? Tesla model prices can vary based on their features and customization. Here is an overview of the starting prices for each model: Tesla Model S: Starting at 92,990€ The base price of the Tesla Model S starts at 92,990€ for the “Long Range” version with all-wheel drive. Higher performance versions with additional options can exceed 107,990€. Tesla Model 3: Starting at 39,990€, the cheapest Tesla The base price of the Tesla Model 3 is 39,990€ for the standard version with rear-wheel drive. However, prices can significantly increase with additional options and performance upgrades, reaching over 55,990€ for the new Tesla Model 3 Performance Ludicrous . Tesla Model X: The most expensive Tesla starting at 99,990€ The base price of the Tesla Model X is around 99,990€ for the “Long Range” version with all-wheel drive. Versions with additional options and performance upgrades can exceed 114,990€. Tesla Model Y: One of the cheaper options starting at 44,990 € Like the Model 3, the base price of the Model Y varies depending on the version and options. The base price starts at 44,990€ for the standard version with rear-wheel drive. With additional options and performance upgrades, the price can exceed 57,990€ for the higher performance version with all-wheel drive. The Model 3 generally has the lowest base price , followed by the Model Y, which has a mid-range price. The Model S and Model X are the high-end models of Tesla and therefore have the highest costs . How do Tesla models compare in terms of range? When comparing the range of Tesla models, it can vary depending on the specific version and battery capacity . Here is an estimate of the range for each model: Tesla Model S: The best range on the market The range of the Tesla Model S ranges from around 628 to 723 kilometers , depending on the version. It’s important to consider if the Tesla Model S is second-hand and the battery capacity of the electric car. Tesla Model 3: The compact model with substantial range The range of the Model 3 varies between approximately 409 and 629 kilometers depending on the battery condition. 		<script>
		//header scrolling up and down
		let lastScrollTop = 0; // Para almacenar la última posición del scroll

		// Función que se ejecuta cuando el usuario hace scroll
		window.addEventListener('scroll', function() {
		  let header = document.getElementById('masthead');
		  let currentScroll = window.pageYOffset || document.documentElement.scrollTop;

		  // Si el usuario está desplazándose hacia abajo
		  if (currentScroll > lastScrollTop) {
			// Oculta el header cuando se desplaza hacia abajo
			header.classList.add('hidden');
		  } else {
			// Muestra el header cuando se desplaza hacia arriba
			header.classList.remove('hidden');
		  }

		  // Actualiza la última posición del scroll
		  lastScrollTop = currentScroll <= 0 ? 0 : currentScroll; // Previene que el valor sea negativo
		});

		document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function () {
    function applyStyles() {
        // Verifica si el ancho de la pantalla es mayor o igual a 900px
        if (window.innerWidth >= 900) {
            // Busca todos los elementos UL dentro del mega menú
            const megaMenuItems = document.querySelectorAll(".mega-wpml-ls-slot-28 ul");

            // Itera sobre cada UL encontrado y aplica los estilos deseados
            megaMenuItems.forEach(ul => {
                ul.style.maxWidth = "4em";
                ul.style.marginLeft = "1em";
            });
        } else {
            // Opcional: Si la pantalla es más pequeña, elimina los estilos
            const megaMenuItems = document.querySelectorAll(".mega-wpml-ls-slot-28 ul");
            megaMenuItems.forEach(ul => {
                ul.style.maxWidth = "";
                ul.style.marginLeft = "";
            });
        }
    }
    // Ejecuta la función al cargar la página
    applyStyles();

    // Vuelve a ejecutar la función al redimensionar la ventana
    window.addEventListener("resize", applyStyles);
});
	</script>

<script>
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function () {
  const steps = document.querySelectorAll('.form-row2.step');
  let currentStep = 0;

  function showStep(nextStep, direction) {
    const current = steps[currentStep];
    const next = steps[nextStep];

    // Reset classes
    steps.forEach(step => {
      step.classList.remove('active', 'slide-out-left', 'slide-in-right', 'slide-in-left', 'slide-out-right');
      step.style.display = 'none';
    });

    // Animate current out
    current.classList.add(direction === 'next' ? 'slide-out-left' : 'slide-out-right');

    // Prepare next step animation
    next.style.display = 'block';
    next.classList.add(direction === 'next' ? 'slide-in-right' : 'slide-in-left');

    // Allow animation to complete
    setTimeout(() => {
      current.classList.remove('active');
      next.classList.remove('slide-in-right', 'slide-in-left');
      next.classList.add('active');
      currentStep = nextStep;
    }, 500);
  }

  document.querySelectorAll('.next').forEach(btn => {
    btn.addEventListener('click', () => {
      if (currentStep < steps.length - 1) {
        showStep(currentStep + 1, 'next');
      }
    });
  });

  document.querySelectorAll('.prev').forEach(btn => {
    btn.addEventListener('click', () => {
      if (currentStep > 0) {
        showStep(currentStep - 1, 'prev');
      }
    });
  });

  // Inicializar el primer paso
  steps.forEach((step, i) => {
    step.style.display = 'none';
    if (i === 0) {
      step.classList.add('active');
      step.style.display = 'block';
    }
  });
});
</script>
<script>
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function () {
  document.addEventListener('wpcf7mailsent', function () {
    // Oculta todos los pasos
    const steps = document.querySelectorAll('#responsive-form .step');
    steps.forEach(step => {
      step.style.display = 'none';
    });

    // Oculta el contenedor principal de los pasos
    const contenedor = document.querySelector('.formulario-pasos');
    if (contenedor) {
      contenedor.style.display = 'none';
    }
  }, false);
});
</script>

				<h1 class="entry-title" itemprop="headline">Comparison Between Tesla Models: Model S, Model 3, Model X, and Model Y</h1>		<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="posted-on"><time class="updated" datetime="2024-07-05T12:54:47+02:00" itemprop="dateModified">July 5, 2024</time><time class="entry-date published" datetime="2024-06-10T11:00:00+02:00" itemprop="datePublished">June 10, 2024</time></span> <span class="byline">by <span class="author vcard" itemprop="author" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person" itemscope><a class="url fn n" href="https://v2charge.com/author/marketing/" title="View all posts by V2C" rel="author" itemprop="url"><span class="author-name" itemprop="name">V2C</span></a></span></span> 		</div>
					</header>
			
		<div class="entry-content" itemprop="text">
			
<p>Over the past decade, <strong>Tesla Motors has spearheaded the electric vehicle revolution</strong>, challenging the norms of the automotive industry with its innovative approach and commitment to sustainability. Tesla has been a catalyst for the shift towards cleaner and more efficient mobility. In this context, <strong>it is important to compare the various Tesla models: the Model S, Model 3, Model X, and Model Y.</strong></p>



<p>These vehicles represent different market segments and <strong>offer a variety of features and performance levels</strong>, prompting an examination of how they differ from each other and how they have contributed to the advancement of <a href="https://v2charge.com/history-of-electric-cars-the-evolution-from-the-first-model-to-the-present-day/"><strong>electric car history</strong></a>.</p>

<h2 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="How_do_the_prices_of_Tesla_models_compare"><span style="font-weight: 400;">How do the prices of Tesla models compare?</span></span></h2>



<p><strong>Tesla model prices can vary based on their features and customization. Here is an overview of the starting prices for each model:</strong></p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_S_Starting_at_92990E">Tesla Model S: Starting at 92,990€</span></h3>



<p>The base price of the Tesla Model S<strong> starts at 92,990€</strong> for the “Long Range” version with all-wheel drive. Higher performance versions with <strong>additional options can exceed 107,990€.</strong></p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_3_Starting_at_39990E_the_cheapest_Tesla">Tesla Model 3: Starting at 39,990€, the cheapest Tesla</span></h3>



<p><strong>The base price of the Tesla Model 3 is 39,990€</strong> for the standard version with rear-wheel drive. However, prices can significantly increase with additional options and performance upgrades, <strong>reaching over 55,990€</strong> for the <strong><a href="https://v2charge.com/new-tesla-model-3-performance-cost-autonomy/">new Tesla Model 3 Performance Ludicrous</a>.</strong></p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_X_The_most_expensive_Tesla_starting_at_99990E">Tesla Model X: The most expensive Tesla starting at 99,990€</span></h3>



<p>The base price of the Tesla Model X is around 99,990€ for the “Long Range” version with all-wheel drive. <strong>Versions with additional options and performance upgrades can exceed 114,990€.</strong></p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_Y_One_of_the_cheaper_options_starting_at_44990E"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model Y: One of the cheaper options starting at 44,990</span>€</span></h3>



<p>Like the Model 3, the base price of the Model Y varies depending on the version and options. <strong>The base price starts at 44,990€ </strong>for the standard version with rear-wheel drive. With additional options and performance upgrades, <strong>the price can exceed 57,990€ for the higher performance version</strong> with all-wheel drive.</p>



<p><strong>The Model 3 generally has the lowest base price</strong>, followed by the Model Y, which has a mid-range price. <strong>The Model S and Model X </strong>are the high-end models of Tesla and therefore <strong>have the highest costs</strong>.</p>



<div class="wp-block-uagb-image uagb-block-4eb5332b wp-block-uagb-image--layout-default wp-block-uagb-image--effect-static wp-block-uagb-image--align-none"><figure class="wp-block-uagb-image__figure"><img decoding="async" data-lazy-srcset="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3.jpg ,https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3.jpg 780w, https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3.jpg 360w" data-lazy-sizes="auto, (max-width: 480px) 150px" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20960%20560'%3E%3C/svg%3E" alt="Comparación Autonomía Tesla Model 3 S X" class="uag-image-154087" width="960" height="560" title="comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3" role="img" data-lazy-src="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3.jpg"/><noscript><img decoding="async" srcset="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3.jpg ,https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3.jpg 780w, https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3.jpg 360w" sizes="auto, (max-width: 480px) 150px" src="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3.jpg" alt="Comparación Autonomía Tesla Model 3 S X" class="uag-image-154087" width="960" height="560" title="comparacion-autonomia-modelo-tesla-x-s-3" loading="lazy" role="img"/></noscript></figure></div>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="How_do_Tesla_models_compare_in_terms_of_range"><span style="font-weight: 400;">How do Tesla models compare in terms of range?</span></span></h2>



<p>When comparing the range of Tesla models, <strong>it can vary depending on the specific version and battery capacity</strong>. Here is an estimate of the range for each model:</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_S_The_best_range_on_the_market"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model S: The best range on the market</span></span></h3>



<p>The range of the Tesla Model S <strong>ranges from around 628 to 723 kilometers</strong>, depending on the version. It’s important to consider if the Tesla Model S is second-hand and the battery capacity of the electric car.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_3_The_compact_model_with_substantial_range"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model 3: The compact model with substantial range</span></span></h3>



<p>The range of the Model 3 <strong>varies between approximately 409 and 629 kilometers</strong> depending on the battery condition. It is necessary to consider if the Tesla Model 3 is second-hand or the different technical details of the electric car.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_X_Designed_for_long_journeys">Tesla Model X: Designed for long journeys</span></h3>



<p>The range of the Model X<strong> is approximately between 507 and 625 kilometers</strong>, depending on the car configuration. It is also necessary to know if the Tesla Model X is second-hand or other technical specifications.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_Y_The_model_with_the_least_range"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model Y: The model with the least range</span></span></h3>



<p>The Model Y usually h<strong>as a range similar to the Model 3</strong>, as they share many technical and design features. Therefore, <strong>its range would be in the range of 409 to 600 kilometers</strong>. It is necessary to consider the technical details you choose when buying it or if the Tesla Model Y is second-hand.</p>



<p>The Tesla model with the best range depends on factors such as the version and condition of the vehicle, the types of batteries according to the models, and energy efficiency. <strong>Generally, both the Model S and Model X, being larger</strong>, can offer a greater range due to larger battery options. However, the Model 3 and Model Y, being more compact, can also offer impressive ranges. <strong>The choice of the best model will depend on the individual needs of the driver.</strong></p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="How_do_the_sizes_of_Tesla_models_compare"><span style="font-weight: 400;">How do the sizes of Tesla models compare?</span></span></h2>



<p><strong>Tesla has a modern and luxurious approach to its design both interior and exterior across all models</strong>. The size of Teslas is something we want to look at closely, as when searching for a vehicle we want to know if the space for ourselves and for luggage is what we are looking for. <strong>In this section, we will explain the different sizes of Tesla models and their trunks:</strong></p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_S_The_most_luxurious_interior_on_the_market"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model S: The most luxurious interior on the market</span></span></h3>



<p>The Tesla Model S <strong>is a full-size luxury sedan with an aerodynamic and elegant design</strong>. The Tesla Model S has a spacious interior with capacity for five people. <strong>It has a height of 1987 mm and a length of 5021 mm.</strong></p>



<p>The Tesla Model S has two trunks. <strong>The rear trunk has a capacity of 1739 L</strong> and it also has a front trunk with 183 L.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_3_The_most_compact_electric_car"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model 3: The most compact electric car</span></span></h3>



<p>The Tesla Model 3 <strong>is a mid-sized compact vehicle</strong>, designed to offer a mix of efficiency and interior space. <strong>It has a length of 4,720 mm and a height of 1,849 mm with a capacity for up to 5 passengers.</strong></p>



<p>The Tesla Model 3 has two trunks. <strong>The rear trunk has a capacity of 594 L</strong> and the front trunk has a capacity of 88 L.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_X_The_largest_sports_model_from_Tesla"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model X: The largest sports model from Tesla</span></span></h3>



<p>The Tesla Model X <strong>is a large luxury SUV and the tallest of all models</strong>. <strong>It has a height of 1,999 mm and a length of 5,057 mm with a capacity for seven passengers.</strong></p>



<p><strong>The Tesla Model X has two trunks.</strong> The rear trunk has a capacity of up to 2,410 L with the rear seats folded. The front trunk has a capacity of 183 L.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_Y_A_trunk_suited_to_its_size"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model Y: A trunk suited to its size</span></span></h3>



<p><strong>The Tesla Model Y is a compact luxury SUV</strong>, offering a combination of size and interior space. <strong>It has a height of 1,921 mm and a length of 4,751 mm with a capacity for up to five passengers and a spacious rear trunk.</strong></p>



<p><strong>The rear trunk of the Tesla Model Y has a capacity of 854 L with the seats not folded and 2,041 L with the seats folded</strong>. The front trunk has a capacity of 117 L.</p>



<p>Tesla offers a variety of models that <strong>vary in size and functionality to suit the needs and preferences of drivers. The Model 3 and Model Y are more compact and agile models</strong>, ideal for urban and family driving, with the Model Y offering slightly more space and versatility due to its SUV design. <strong>On the other hand, the Model S and Model X are larger models with greater trunk and passenger capacity.</strong></p>



<div class="wp-block-uagb-image uagb-block-b082ebf5 wp-block-uagb-image--layout-default wp-block-uagb-image--effect-static wp-block-uagb-image--align-none"><figure class="wp-block-uagb-image__figure"><img decoding="async" data-lazy-srcset="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/tesla-model-x-maletero-interior.jpg ,https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/tesla-model-x-maletero-interior.jpg 780w, https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/tesla-model-x-maletero-interior.jpg 360w" data-lazy-sizes="auto, (max-width: 480px) 150px" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20960%20560'%3E%3C/svg%3E" alt="Tesla Model X Maletero Interior " class="uag-image-154120" width="960" height="560" title="tesla-model-x-maletero-interior" role="img" data-lazy-src="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/tesla-model-x-maletero-interior.jpg"/><noscript><img decoding="async" srcset="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/tesla-model-x-maletero-interior.jpg ,https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/tesla-model-x-maletero-interior.jpg 780w, https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/tesla-model-x-maletero-interior.jpg 360w" sizes="auto, (max-width: 480px) 150px" src="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/tesla-model-x-maletero-interior.jpg" alt="Tesla Model X Maletero Interior " class="uag-image-154120" width="960" height="560" title="tesla-model-x-maletero-interior" loading="lazy" role="img"/></noscript></figure></div>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="How_safe_are_Tesla_models"><span style="font-weight: 400;">How safe are Tesla models?</span></span></h2>



<p>Tesla models <strong>are equipped with a wide variety of safety features</strong> designed to protect occupants and prevent accidents. Although these features are quite similar, they can vary depending on the size and model.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_S_The_most_adaptable_interior"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model S: The most adaptable interior</span></span></h3>



<p>The Model S <strong>offers similar safety features to the Model 3</strong>, including automatic emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and lane-keeping assistance. The model also comes with various anti-theft systems, electronic stability control, and anti-lock brakes (ABS). Additionally, <strong>the vehicle’s spaciousness can facilitate easy distribution of luggage for safety.</strong></p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_3_A_small_and_safe_model"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model 3: A small and safe model</span></span></h3>



<p>The Model 3 <strong>features standard active safety features</strong> such as automatic emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and lane-keeping assistance. It also comes with multiple airbags, electronic stability control, and anti-lock brakes (ABS). Additionally, <strong>it includes Tesla’s passive safety system</strong>, designed to protect occupants in the event of a collision.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_X_The_vehicle_with_the_best_access"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model X: The vehicle with the best access</span></span></h3>



<p><strong>The Model X shares many of the safety features of the Model S and Model 3</strong>, including automatic emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and lane-keeping assistance. <strong>Additionally, the Model X comes with unique features such as “falcon wing”</strong> doors, providing easier access to the vehicle in various situations.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_Y_Equipped_with_over-the-air_updates"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model Y: Equipped with over-the-air updates</span></span></h3>



<p><strong>The Model Y is equipped with similar safety features to other Tesla models</strong>, such as automatic emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and lane-keeping assistance. <strong>It also includes</strong> multiple airbags, electronic stability control, and anti-lock brakes (ABS). Moreover, <strong>Tesla’s passive safety system can provide software updates to address security issues or improve vehicle reliability</strong>. This can include security patches to protect against potential vulnerabilities or diagnostic updates to enhance predictive maintenance.</p>



<p>All Tesla models <strong>offer a comprehensive set of active and passive safety features</strong> designed to protect occupants and minimize the risk of accidents.</p>



<p>In conclusion, <strong>Tesla models stand out for their commitment to safety, featuring very similar safety systems across the range</strong>. From their robust body structures to advanced battery technology and driver assistance systems, each model offers a safe and reliable driving experience. Furthermore, <strong>features like “Sentry Mode” demonstrate the ongoing focus on protecting</strong> both passengers and the vehicle. <strong>Additionally, Tesla maintains continuous development in software and other technological systems.</strong></p>



<div class="wp-block-uagb-image uagb-block-39498f5e wp-block-uagb-image--layout-default wp-block-uagb-image--effect-static wp-block-uagb-image--align-none"><figure class="wp-block-uagb-image__figure"><a class="" href="https://v2charge.com/trydan/" target="" rel="noopener"><img decoding="async" data-lazy-srcset="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/discover-trydan-smart-charger.jpg ,https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/discover-trydan-smart-charger.jpg 780w, https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/discover-trydan-smart-charger.jpg 360w" data-lazy-sizes="auto, (max-width: 480px) 150px" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20818%20248'%3E%3C/svg%3E" alt="discover trydan v2c" class="uag-image-159067" width="818" height="248" title="discover-trydan-smart-charger" role="img" data-lazy-src="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/discover-trydan-smart-charger.jpg"/><noscript><img decoding="async" srcset="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/discover-trydan-smart-charger.jpg ,https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/discover-trydan-smart-charger.jpg 780w, https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/discover-trydan-smart-charger.jpg 360w" sizes="auto, (max-width: 480px) 150px" src="https://v2charge.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/discover-trydan-smart-charger.jpg" alt="discover trydan v2c" class="uag-image-159067" width="818" height="248" title="discover-trydan-smart-charger" loading="lazy" role="img"/></noscript></a></figure></div>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="What_are_the_battery_capacities_of_Tesla_models"><span style="font-weight: 400;">What are the battery capacities of Tesla models?</span></span></h2>



<p>The battery life of Tesla models <strong>can vary depending on the specific version, battery capacity, and other factors such as driving style and weather conditions</strong>. Here is an estimate of the typical battery life for each model:</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_S_A_more_powerful_battery_than_other_models"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model S: A more powerful battery than other models</span></span></h3>



<p>The Model S is known for having one of the longest ranges within the Tesla product line. Generally, <strong>the Model S is expected to offer a battery capacity of 95.0 kWh</strong> and an approximate range of 575 km on a single charge. This depends on whether the Tesla Model S is second-hand and the size and specifications of the electric car.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_3_The_most_optimal_battery"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model 3: The most optimal battery</span></span></h3>



<p>The battery life of the Model 3 can vary depending on the version and capacity. Under optimal conditions, <strong>the Model 3 is expected to have a maximum capacity of 57.5 kWh</strong>. It is necessary to consider whether the Tesla Model 3 is second-hand or has other characteristics.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_X_The_SUV_with_less_battery_life"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model X: The SUV with less battery life</span></span></h3>



<p>Being a larger SUV, <strong>the Model X can have a slightly shorter battery life compared to smaller models</strong>. Under optimal conditions, <strong>the Model X has a battery capacity of 95 kWh</strong> with an average range of 578 kilometers. This is normal in relation to its size and can vary if the Tesla Model X is second-hand or the characteristics of the electric car. </p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="Tesla_Model_Y_Various_customization_options"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tesla Model Y: Various customization options</span></span></h3>



<p>Like the Model 3, the Model Y’s battery life can vary depending on the version and battery capacity. <strong>It is estimated that the Model Y can offer a usable battery capacity of 57.5 kWh</strong> with a range of around 409 km on a single charge, although <strong>this can vary depending on the electric car’s configuration or if the Tesla Model Y is second-hand.</strong></p>



<p>Tesla models <strong>feature advanced lithium-ion battery technology that offers exceptional performance and high reliability</strong>. These batteries <strong>are designed to provide impressive range and fast charging</strong>. With its continuous focus on innovation, <strong>Tesla continues to advance battery technology</strong>, offering an exceptionally safe and reliable driving experience. However, it should be noted that the electric car’s battery capacity decreases with more usage.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading"><span id="What_type_of_charger_does_a_Tesla_use"><span style="font-weight: 400;">What type of charger does a Tesla use?</span></span></h2>



<p>If you’re wondering what type of charger Teslas use, all Tesla models use a Type 2 connector (Mennekes – IEC 62196 – Chameleon). <strong>This connector is easy to handle and compatible with a variety of public and home charging stations in Europe</strong>. Additionally, <strong>it is compatible with Trydan and our smartlock technology</strong>.</p>



<p>Tesla has also developed an adaptive charging system called “Chameleon,” which <strong>allows the vehicle to adjust its charging speed according to the available electrical infrastructure</strong>. This design choice prioritizes compatibility and ease of use for Tesla owners.</p>

/* Spinner (círculo de carga) */
.cf7-overlay {
    position: absolute;
    top: 0;
    left: 0;
    right: 0;
    bottom: 0;
    background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.7); /* Fondo negro con transparencia */
    display: none; /* Oculto por defecto */
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    z-index: 9999;
}

.cf7-spinner {
    border: 5px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2); /* Bordes grises claros con opacidad */
    border-top: 5px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8); /* Color blanco con opacidad */
    border-radius: 50%;
    width: 50px;
    height: 50px;
    animation: spin 1s linear infinite;
}

@keyframes spin {
    0% { transform: rotate(0deg); }
    100% { transform: rotate(360deg); }
}

</style>
<script>
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function () {
    // Selecciona todos los formularios CF7 en la página
    const forms = document.querySelectorAll('.wpcf7');

    forms.forEach(form => {
        // Crear el overlay y el spinner
        const overlay = document.createElement('div');
        overlay.classList.add('cf7-overlay');
        const spinner = document.createElement('div');
        spinner.classList.add('cf7-spinner');
        overlay.appendChild(spinner);
        form.style.position = 'relative';
        form.appendChild(overlay);

        // Cuando el formulario comienza a procesarse
        form.addEventListener('wpcf7beforesubmit', function (event) {
            overlay.style.display = 'flex'; // Mostrar el overlay con el spinner
        }, false);

        // Cuando el envío del formulario es exitoso
        form.addEventListener('wpcf7mailsent', function (event) {
            overlay.style.display = 'none'; // Ocultar el overlay cuando el envío es exitoso

            const successMessage = form.querySelector('.wpcf7-response-output');
            if (successMessage) {
                successMessage.style.display = 'block'; // Mostrar el mensaje de éxito
            }

            // Desplazamiento del 10% hacia abajo
            const scrollAmount = window.innerHeight * 0.3; // Calcula el 10% de la altura de la ventana
            window.scrollBy({
                top: scrollAmount,
                behavior: 'smooth' // Desplazamiento suave
            });
        }, false);

        // Si el formulario es inválido (errores de validación)
        form.addEventListener('wpcf7invalid', function (event) {
            overlay.style.display = 'none'; // Ocultar el overlay en caso de error
        }, false);

        // Si el envío falla por otro motivo (problema en el servidor)
        form.addEventListener('wpcf7mailfailed', function (event) {
            overlay.style.display = 'none'; // Ocultar el overlay en caso de fallo
        }, false);
    });
});
</script>
